description: This department focuses on diagnosing and treating disorders of the digestive system, including the stomach, liver, intestines, pancreas, and esophagus. Common issues treated here are acid reflux, irritable bowel syndrome, ulcers, hepatitis, and other chronic or acute digestive conditions. The specialists also perform endoscopic procedures to assess internal problems and provide targeted treatments.

Pulmonology specializes in diseases affecting the respiratory system, including the lungs and airways. Common conditions include asthma, chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD), lung infections like pneumonia, bronchitis, and pulmonary fibrosis. Pulmonologists also treat complex conditions like sleep apnea and perform procedures such as bronchoscopy for diagnostic and therapeutic purposes.

Cardiology focuses on diagnosing and treating heart-related problems. These include heart attacks, arrhythmias, high blood pressure, coronary artery disease, and congenital heart defects. Cardiologists use advanced imaging tools, stress tests, and catheterizations to assess heart function and provide medical or interventional treatments like angioplasty and stenting.

Neurology addresses disorders of the nervous system, including the brain, spinal cord, and peripheral nerves. Neurologists diagnose and treat migraines, epilepsy, Parkinson’s disease, multiple sclerosis, stroke, and neurodegenerative disorders like Alzheimer’s disease. They use techniques like EEG, MRI, and nerve conduction studies to provide accurate diagnoses.

Orthopedics deals with issues related to the musculoskeletal system, including bones, joints, ligaments, and muscles. Conditions such as fractures, arthritis, sports injuries, and spinal deformities are treated here. Orthopedic surgeons perform joint replacements, corrective surgeries, and minimally invasive procedures to restore mobility and relieve pain.

Dermatology focuses on the diagnosis and treatment of skin, hair, and nail conditions. Common issues include acne, eczema, psoriasis, and skin infections. Dermatologists also manage cosmetic concerns such as wrinkles, scars, and hair loss. They use advanced therapies, including laser treatments and biopsies, to address various dermatological issues.

Ophthalmology specializes in eye health and vision care. Ophthalmologists treat conditions such as cataracts, glaucoma, macular degeneration, and diabetic retinopathy. They also manage vision correction procedures like LASIK and handle eye injuries or infections. Advanced diagnostic tools and surgeries help preserve and restore vision in patients.

Endocrinology deals with hormonal imbalances and endocrine gland disorders. Common conditions include diabetes, thyroid diseases, adrenal dysfunction, and growth disorders. Endocrinologists use blood tests, imaging, and advanced therapies to regulate hormone levels and provide personalized treatment plans to manage these complex health issues.

Oncology is dedicated to the diagnosis and treatment of cancer. Oncologists specialize in managing different types of cancers through chemotherapy, radiation, immunotherapy, and targeted therapies. They provide comprehensive care, including early detection, palliative care, and long-term monitoring to ensure the best possible outcomes for patients.

Urology focuses on diseases of the urinary tract in both men and women, as well as male reproductive health. Urologists treat kidney stones, urinary tract infections, bladder control problems, and prostate disorders. They also perform minimally invasive surgeries, such as prostatectomy and kidney stone removal, to improve patient health.

Nephrology specializes in kidney health and the management of conditions like chronic kidney disease, acute kidney injury, and hypertension. Nephrologists provide care for patients requiring dialysis and perform kidney biopsies to diagnose complex disorders. They also focus on preventing kidney failure through early intervention and lifestyle modifications.

Hematology is the branch of medicine dealing with blood-related disorders. Hematologists treat conditions such as anemia, leukemia, lymphoma, and clotting disorders like hemophilia. They perform bone marrow biopsies, blood transfusions, and advanced diagnostics to manage and monitor blood health and related diseases effectively.

Psychiatry focuses on mental health and emotional well-being. Psychiatrists diagnose and treat conditions like depression, anxiety, bipolar disorder, and schizophrenia. They provide therapy, prescribe medications, and use advanced techniques like transcranial magnetic stimulation (TMS) to help patients manage mental health challenges and improve their quality of life.

Rheumatology specializes in autoimmune and inflammatory diseases affecting the joints, muscles, and connective tissues. Common conditions include rheumatoid arthritis, lupus, and gout. Rheumatologists provide comprehensive care, including advanced imaging, laboratory tests, and medications to reduce inflammation and preserve joint function.

Pediatrics focuses on the health and development of infants, children, and adolescents. Pediatricians provide preventive care, vaccinations, and treatment for common childhood illnesses such as respiratory infections, growth disorders, and developmental delays. They also counsel parents on nutrition, safety, and other aspects of child well-being.

Gynecology deals with women's reproductive health. Gynecologists manage conditions such as menstrual disorders, ovarian cysts, and pelvic inflammatory disease. They also provide prenatal care, family planning services, and menopause management. Advanced diagnostic tools and minimally invasive procedures help ensure comprehensive care for women.

ENT specializes in conditions affecting the ear, nose, and throat. Common issues include hearing loss, sinusitis, throat infections, and vertigo. ENT specialists perform surgeries such as tonsillectomy, sinus surgery, and cochlear implantation. They use advanced diagnostic tools to ensure precise treatment and improved patient outcomes.

Plastic Surgery focuses on reconstructive and cosmetic procedures. Surgeons repair injuries, correct congenital deformities, and perform aesthetic surgeries like facelifts and rhinoplasty. They also specialize in complex procedures such as burn reconstruction and microsurgery, ensuring functional and aesthetic restoration for patients.

Allergy and Immunology deal with allergic reactions and immune system disorders. Specialists treat conditions like asthma, food allergies, hay fever, and immunodeficiencies. They perform allergy testing, desensitization therapy, and provide long-term management plans to help patients lead healthier lives.

General Surgery covers a wide range of surgical procedures for various conditions. Surgeons manage appendicitis, hernias, gallbladder issues, and abdominal trauma. They use minimally invasive and robotic techniques to ensure faster recovery and reduced complications, providing comprehensive care for surgical patients.

Vascular Surgery focuses on diseases of the blood vessels, including arteries, veins, and lymphatic circulation. Common conditions include varicose veins, aneurysms, and peripheral artery disease. Vascular surgeons perform advanced procedures such as angioplasty, stenting, and bypass surgeries to restore proper blood flow.
